0P00005VAB.BO.long_name: DSP India T.I.G.E.R. Fund Regular Plan Dividend Payout
0P00005VAB.BO.summary: To generate capital appreciation, from a portfolio that is substantially constituted of equity securities and equity related securities of corporates, which could benefit from structural changes brought about by continuing liberalization in economic policies by the government and/or continuing investments in infrastructure, both by the public and private sector.

0P00005VAC.BO.long_name: DSP India T.I.G.E.R. Fund - Regular Plan - Growth
0P00005VAC.BO.summary: To generate capital appreciation, from a portfolio that is substantially constituted of equity securities and equity related securities of corporates, which could benefit from structural changes brought about by continuing liberalization in economic policies by the government and/or continuing investments in infrastructure, both by the public and private sector.

0P0000AEK3.BO.long_name: Kotak Infrastructure and Economic Reform Fund - Standard Plan-Growth
0P0000AEK3.BO.summary: The investment objective of the scheme is to generate long-term capital appreciation from a diversified portfolio of predominantly equity and equity-related securities of companies involved in economic development of India as a result of potential investments in infrastructure and unfolding economic reforms. However, there is no assurance that the objective of the scheme will be realized.
0P0000AEK3.BO.manager_bio: Krishnan has served as a portfolio manager since the Fundâs inception and as the Investment Manager of Mid Cap and Concentrated Strategies at Kotak from December 2007 to present. Prior to this, his roles included Research Analyst with Kotak from December 2006 to December 2007 and Portfolio Adviser with Kotak Mahindra Asset Management Company Limited from June 2005 to December 2006.
0P0000AEK3.BO.family: Kotak Mahindra Asset Management Co Ltd

0P0000XV0S.BO.long_name: IDFC Infrastructure Fund - Direct Plan - Growth
0P0000XV0S.BO.summary: The investment objective of the scheme is to seek to generate long-term capital growth through an active diversified portfolio of predominantly equity and equity related instruments of companies that are participating in and benefiting from growth in Indian infrastructure and infrastructural related activities. However, there can be no assurance that the investment objective of the scheme will be realized.
